column4: Let me ask you a question.  I want to install rt73 wifi driver on Ubuntu Studio 8.04.  But when I install the driver, it bump into errors "make: *** /lib/modules/2.6.24-19-rt/build: No such file or directory.".  I already installed build-essentials and linux-headers-2.6.24.19-rt.  How should I install the driver on my realtime kernel?
yes.  I can see the build folder on other generic kernels.  Just RT kernel has no build folder.
I have another error now.  make[1]: Entering directory `/lib/modules/2.6.24-19-rt/build'
look in the make file for the target module
sorry, what do you mean by that?
open the make file and look for the target "modules"
yeah, I found the line about build folder in Makefile.  " KERNEL_SOURCES := /lib/modules/$(shell uname -r)/build".  but I don't know what it says....
it's really that simple, it's a meta package that does all the work for you
I tried to apt-get ubuntustudio-* packages but my computer still seems to use non rt kernel.
it should install the rt kernel too
ya, I installed it too. then I type "uname -r" in console and it said "2.6.28-11-generic"....
you need to reboot - and select the rt kernel
thanks. I'll try to manage GRUB. :)
